translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Book of Conditional Relations in the reverse order

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kusalattika cūḍantaraduka
translated: The Triad-couplet Conditional Relations🔽A profitable, not-a-signless, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as proximity condition, for a profitable, signless, desire-to-do state. …🔽A profitable, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant, desire-to-do state. …

original: Nakusalo nasappaccayo dhammo kusalassa sappaccayassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …. Ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā upanissaye cha. (Saṅkhataṁ sappaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: na kusalaḥ na sappaccayaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa sappaccayassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā upanissaye cha saṅkhatam sappaccaya sadisa
translated: A profitable, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as object condition, for a functional, desire-to-do state. …🔽A profitable, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant, desire-to-do state. …🔽A profitable, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as object condition, for a functional, desire-to-do state. …

original: Nakusalaṁ nasanidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sanidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.🔽Nakusalo naanidassano dhammo kusalassa anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: na kusalam na sa nidassanam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha  na kusalaḥ na anidassanaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena

original: paccayo. (Nava pañhā kātabbā.) Ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā tīṇi, upanissaye purejāte
analyzed: paccayaḥ nava pañhā kātabbā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā tīṇi upanissaye purejāte
translated: A profitable, not-a-desire-to-do state is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant, desire-to-do state. …
Nine if not removed, if not departed.

original: Nakusalaṁ nasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.🔽Nakusalaṁ naappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato appaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nakusalaṁ narūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato rūpī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) original: Nakusalaṁ nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato lokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na kusalam na lokiyam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ lokiyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: With a profitable, mundane state as condition, an unwholesome, mundane state arises … (in brief:🔽With a profitable, supramundane state as condition, a profitable, supramundane state arises …

original: Nakusalaṁ nalokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo lokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nakusalaṁ nalokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā abyākato lokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na kusalam na lokuttaram dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ lokuttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na kusalam na lokuttaram dhammam paccayā abyākataḥ lokuttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a profitable, supramundane state as condition, an indeterminate, supramundane state arises …

original: (Cha pañhā kātabbā.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: cha pañhā kātabbā hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: (The six questions are to be constructed in detail.)

original: Nakusalaṁ nakenaci viññeyyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kenaci viññeyyo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na kusalam na kenacid viññeyyam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kenacid viññeyyaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a profitable state that is cognizable by one or other of the six kinds of consciousness as condition, an unprofitable state cognizable by one or other of the six kinds of consciousness arises …

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: (In brief:) With a cause as condition, eighteen … With an object as condition, nine … With a nutriment as condition, three … With a faculty as condition, eighteen …

original: Nakusalaṁ nakenaci naviññeyyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kenaci viññeyyo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na kusalam na kenaci na viññeyyam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kenaci viññeyyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: With a profitable state that is cognizable by one or other of the six kinds of consciousness as condition, an unprofitable state cognizable by one or other of the six kinds of consciousness arises …

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: With cause as condition. (In brief.) With cause as condition, there are eighteen. With object as condition, there are nine. … With nutriment as condition, there are three. … With the unformed as condition, there are eighteen.
